comments:
Active Search generally, whenever I interact with it, makes Eclipse become unresponsive for up to minutes at a time.

This has always been the case across all Mylar/Eclipse versions I have tried. However, with Eclipse 3.2M4 it is worse than before.

Example:

1) I open Eclipse. (Active Hierarchy/Active Search are not shown yet.)
2) I do Window -> Show View -> Active Search.
3) Eclipse's CPU usage jumps to ~100%, with Eclipse becoming completely unresponsive -- no interaction possible, barely any repaints.
4) This lasts for around 10 minutes, at which points I am able to close the tab.

I will attach some additional information shortly.

Mylar 0.4.6.1, Eclipse 3.2M4.

eclipse.buildId=I20051215-1506
java.version=1.5.0_04
java.vendor=BEA Systems, Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=no_NO
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -data C:\home\config\eclipse

Created an attachment (id=31967)
Eclipse log

The log shows repeated exceptions from Active Search, logged during the time at which Eclipse is unresponsive.
(This exception seems identical to the one I reported in bug 121438.)

Created an attachment (id=31968)
CPU/heap view

JRockit Management Console showing Eclipse heap and CPU stats.

Created an attachment (id=31969)
Eclipse thread stack traces

Thread stack traces for unresponse Eclipse.

Subsequently Eclipse becomes unstable. All attempts at opening an editor fails with:

*** Bug 121438 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

(From update of attachment 31968)
In the CPU/heap view, the spike at 09:20 is selecting the task. The spike starting at 09:45 is when the Active Search tab is activated.
This will have to wait until the Active Search revamp, which will probably get done for 0.4.9 or 0.4.10.  For now the view is marked "(Experimental)".
Active Search moved back into Sandbox.
